sentences.text:
Run chrome with --enable-extensions and click on one of the themes in 
src/chrome/test/data/extensions/ (theme.

There's a long 
pause when the theme is being installed and the download arrow hangs while 
the theme switches.
Glen, does the image loading from the extension happen on the UI thread?

I 
also wonder if we're spending a noticeable amount of time tinting images on 
the UI thread.

Some quick profiling seems to suggest that it's the calls to GenerateFrameImages and 
GenerateTabImages that are slow.

In particular, generating the bitmaps for 
IDR_THEME_TAB_BACKGROUND and IDR_THEME_TAB_BACKGROUND_INCOGNITO is slow.

Seems like 
we could move this to a background thread, but we have to be careful about updating 
the image cache's safely.

This is actually a bigger problem than it seems; those functions also get called on 
startup, and some themes have giant frame images - blurring them can take some time.
In debug mode this is pretty noticeable.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Quick 'low-risk-for-the-next-release' fix to increase theme install/load perf (should be a 2-4x speedup).
Bug should remain open until a better approach (background threads, perhaps) is used.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Merge 22487 - Quick 'lowriskforthenextrelease' fix to increase theme install/load perf (should be a 24x speedup).
Bug should remain open until a better approach (background threads, perhaps) is used.

Any chance this fix will be included in the next Dev 
release?
The following revision refers to this bug:
Merge 22487 - Quick 'lowriskforthenextrelease' fix to increase theme install/load perf (should be a 24x speedup).
Bug should remain open until a better approach (background threads, perhaps) is used.
(No comment was entered for this change.
Pending judging this until we have the ability to run performance tests.

I am working on backgrounding these changes for browser startup right now; next change 
will be to run the theme install on a background thread, as Tony suggested.

This 
should fix the problem of all the skia manipulations taking over the UI thread.

And Elliot for the Linux side?

I am going to try to start tentatively working on UI stuff on the Mac side as well as

Elliot, I'm hoping you'll take 
the Linux bit, unless you have objections.
